Single player:
This storyline is awesome. I wont spoil it though. The shifts in power are interesting, the puzzles are challenging enough to enterain but not so hard that you'll never figure it out. The controls (xbox 360 controller) could be a little more fine-tuned but its not bad. 

Community test chambers:
Somehow my xbox 360 controller isnt usable in most of the menus here. If you manage to struggle through them with the assistance of mouse and keyboard, You'll have access to a huge amount of extra gaming time. Being community-made, these levels have a variety of difficulty and they use some elements that are not in the single player game. 

Sounds & songs:
The sound effects in the levels are very nice. They create a wonderful atmosphere. This is heavily contrasted by long, soundless, loading screens. I have discovered only one song in the game yet, "want you gone" in the end credits. I freaking love this song. Please, if you beat the game, take the time to listen to the music, the song and the speech at the end.

Portal 2 is easily one of my all-time favorite games.
